intro: Erica sessiliflora var. sceptriformis, commonly known as the purple heath, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage of narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate coastal conditions.
